definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
place of interest/a place one has one's eye on

sentences.english: The eyespots are great for confusing predators.
sentences.chinese: 这些眼点对迷惑捕食者非常有用。

sentences.english: Then, what should the innovation focus on in the economic downturn?
sentences.chinese: 那么，经济低迷期，企业创新的主要着眼点在哪里？

sentences.english: Focused on the long-term development and comprehensive evaluation of many perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 着眼点在于企业的长远发展和多视角的综合评价。

sentences.english: We accepted self-determination with a view to ending war once and for all," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们接受的是以永远结束战争为着眼点进行自主决定。

sentences.english: In this paper, this is the most in-depth and focus boils down to a point.
sentences.chinese: 这是本文最深入的一个着眼点和归结点。

sentences.english: Our counterinsurgency campaign in Afghanistan is really focused on winning the people.
sentences.chinese: 而我们在阿富汗的平叛运动的真正着眼点是赢得民心。

sentences.english: Text has become the new emphasis of contrastive study.
sentences.chinese: 语篇开始成为对比研究新的着眼点。

sentences.english: The subject build is a focal point of hospital technology build.
sentences.chinese: 学科建设是医院技术建设的着眼点。

sentences.english: No, we have very different approaches.
sentences.chinese: 不，我们有非常不同的着眼点。

definition: to have one's eyes on (a goal)/having sth in mind/to concentrate
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to focus light (e.g. in theater)/to spotlight
eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
camera oculi/aqueous chamber of the eye
